content.rendered:
Frozen taro cube have an average size of 3x3x3 cm or larger. The size depends on the customer. The taro are cut into cubes and frozen at a temperature of -40 to -35 degrees celsius, therefore they have a shelf life of up to 2 years if stored at -18 degrees Celsius. Taro cube are often used to cook soup, ground to make cakes…

Process of Frozen Taro Cube

After being cleaned, the taro tubes will be peeled and removed from the inedible parts.

The taro are washed and cut into circles, about 3 cm thick and then cut into cube

Fresh taro are cut in cube, they have an average size of 3x3x3cm, they are vacuum packed in 500g or 1kg/bag.
